1.text: After the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.

2.text: Behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came to roll away the stone from the door, and [the angel] sat on it.

3.text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.

4.text: Out of fear, the guards were shaken and became as dead.

5.text: The angel told the women, “Do not be afraid! I know that you seek Jesus who has been crucified.

6.text: He is not here, for he is risen, just as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.

7.text: Go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.’ Behold, this is my message for you.”

8.text: They departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to report it to his disciples.

9.text: As they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” They came forward and took hold of his feet, and expressed adoration to him.

10.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid! Go tell my brethren that they should go into Galilee. There, they will see me.”

11.text: While they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.

12.text: When they were assembled with the presbyters in order to take counsel, they gave the soldiers a large amount of silver,

13.text: with these words: “Say that his disciples came by night and stole him away while we slept.

14.text: If this comes to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him and make you free of worry.”

15.text: And so, they took the money and did as they were told. This story is widespread among the Jews to this day.

16.text: The eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had directed them.

17.text: When they saw him, they expressed adoration to him, but they doubted.

18.text: Jesus came to them and said, “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.

19.text: Go [therefore] and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the Name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

20.text: teaching them to observe all the things that I have commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen!
